title: Gores Guggenheim SPAC Nears Deal to Combine With Polestar
sub_head: Deal would value electric-vehicle maker at $21 billion, sources say
body:
Polestar is nearing a deal to go public through a merger with a special-purpose acquisition company that would value the Swedish electric-vehicle maker at $21 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.
Polestar, owned by Chinese car maker Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co., is in advanced talks with Gores Guggenheim Inc. and could reach a deal by Monday, the people said, assuming talks donâ€™t fall apart.
